p: Among SFE, subcritical water extraction (SWE) also demonstrated many advantages over traditional methods in the recovery of bioactive compounds from plants, excepting implementation on the industrial scale for the moment [ 93]. Specifically, it takes advantage of the special properties of supercritical water under high temperature and pressure conditions (100–374 °C, >50 bar) to extract nonpolar compounds [ 94]. After a deep study of the influence of operating conditions in the extraction of C. longa essential oil from rhizomes (temperature, flow rate, particle size, time, etc.), SWE has demonstrated its selectivity to enhance a target compound and its suitability as a green and effective method for the extraction of essential oil and curcumin from turmeric rhizome [ 86] ( Table 1).
